description: Number of exterior points formed by extending diagonals of n-gon in general position.
comments: See Gouyou-Beauchamps for an interpretation in terms of closed paths in the first quadrant of the square grid.
references: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 74, Problem 8.
D. Gouyou-Beauchamps, Chemins sous-diagonaux et tableau de Young, pp. 112-125 of "Combinatoire Enumerative (Montreal 1985)", Lect. Notes Math. 1234, 1986.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for sequences related to Young tableaux.
mathematica: s1=s2=s3=0;lst={};Do[a=n+(n+1);s1+=a;s2+=s1;s3+=s2;AppendTo[lst,s3],{n,1,5!}];lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Apr 04 2009 *)CoefficientList[Series[(x - 3) / (x - 1)^5, {x, 0, 50}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jun 09 2013 *)
crossrefs: A diagonal of the triangle in A179898.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Robert G. Wilson v_
